column1: Table 4.2: Laboratory values for urinary parameters in adults

column2: Reference ranges and limits for medical attention

Consistently fasting morning spot urine pH > 5.8 and 
> 6.2 in 24-hr collection (suspicious of renal tubular 
acidosis) [584, 585]

Consistently < 5.5 in morning urine and in 24-hr 
collection (suspicious of acidic arrest) [580, 594]
